headline.main: Taste for Salt Is Shaped Early in Life

docs.abstract: infants whose parents fed them starchy table foods like crackers and breakfast cereals, which typically contain added salt, were more likely to gravitate to salty foods by the time they reached preschool.
docs.snippet: infants whose parents fed them starchy table foods like crackers and breakfast cereals, which typically contain added salt, were more likely to gravitate to salty foods by the time they reached preschool.

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity has urged Science and Nature to keep details out of reports that they intend to publish on a highly transmissible form of the bird flu.

headline.seo: U.S. Asks Journals to Censor Articles on Bird Flu Virus
headline.main: Seeing Terror Risk, U.S. Asks Journals to Cut Flu Study Facts
headline.print_headline: Journals Asked To Cut Details Of Flu Studies

docs.abstract: National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity has urged journals Science and Nature to remove detailed information from reports they intend to publish on a highly transmissible form of the bird flu; request is motivated by fear that information could be used by terrorists to create deadly viruses and touch off epidemics; is first instance of a government body requesting self-censorship of a scientific journal.
docs.snippet: The National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity has urged Science and Nature to keep details out of reports that they intend to publish on a highly transmissible form of the bird flu.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and WILLIAM J. BROAD

docs.lead_paragraph: New research indicating that Eva Perón was lobotomized not long before her death is a reminder of how enthusiastically this operation was once embraced.

headline.seo: Report on Eva Perón Recalls Time When Lobotomy Was Embraced
headline.main: When Lobotomy Was Seen as Advanced
headline.print_headline: When Lobotomy Was Seen as Advanced

docs.abstract: Dr Barron H Lerner reflects on new evidence that Eva Peron, the first lady of Argentina, underwent lobotomy for pain related to cervical cancer before her death in 1952; says discovery is sad example of inappropriate use of lobotomies, which were all too common in the 1950s.
docs.snippet: New research indicating that Eva Perón was lobotomized not long before her death is a reminder of how enthusiastically this operation was once embraced.

docs.lead_paragraph: A leading tropical medicine researcher has proposed that the United States extend a friendly hand to Iran over vaccines.

headline.seo: Doctor Urges Reaching Out to Iran oner Leishmaniasis Vaccine
headline.main: Leishmaniasis: Extend Friendly American Hand to Iran? Doctor Says a Vaccine Is a Place to Start
headline.print_headline: Leishmaniasis: Extend Friendly American Hand to Iran? Doctor Says a Vaccine Is a Place to Start

docs.abstract: Dr Peter J Hotez of Baylor College of Medicine publishes article in public policy magazine Miller-McCune advising United States to work with Iran to develop effective vaccine for leishmaniasis.
docs.snippet: A leading tropical medicine researcher has proposed that the United States extend a friendly hand to Iran over vaccines.

docs.lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. has found that a much shorter regimen of isoniazid doses along with another antibiotic, rifapentine, is just as effective as the standard nine-month-long treatment.

headline.seo: A Much Quicker Way to Treat Latent TB
headline.main: Regimens: A Much Quicker Way to Treat Latent TB
headline.print_headline: Regimens: A Much Quicker Way to Treat Latent TB

docs.abstract: New report by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that a regimen of 12 weekly does of isoniazid along with another antibiotic is just as effective as the standard treatment for tuberculosis, which takes nine months; Dr Kenneth G Castro, director of the tuberculosis division at the CDC, notes there are 11.2 million Americans with latent tuberculosis.
docs.snippet: The C.D.C. has found that a much shorter regimen of isoniazid doses along with another antibiotic, rifapentine, is just as effective as the standard nine-month-long treatment.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The rule against posthumous Nobel Prizes has been violated several times — most recently when the prize in medicine was given to the widow of a Rockefeller University scientist.

headline.seo: When the Honor of a Lifetime, a Nobel Prize, Arrives Too Late
headline.main: Honor of a Lifetime, Arriving Too Late
headline.print_headline: Honor of a Lifetime, Arriving Too Late

docs.abstract: Convoluted will left by Alfred Nobel left much room for interpretation and confusion as to how to award the prizes that bear his name; Nobel committee mandated that award be given only to living people starting in 1970, rule that has been violated four times.
docs.snippet: The rule against posthumous Nobel Prizes has been violated several times — most recently when the prize in medicine was given to the widow of a Rockefeller University scientist.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are many centers, which should be the first stop for victims, that offer proper care and increase the likelihood that their attackers are punished.

headline.seo: Supportive Steps to Take After a Sexual Assault
headline.main: Supportive Steps After a Sexual Assault
headline.print_headline: Supportive Steps After a Sexual Assault

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column offers advice on how to proceed if loved one becomes the victim of a sexual assault; notes survey released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that found sexual assaults are far more common than previously believed, with nearly one woman in five reporting that she had been the victim of rape or attempted rape.
docs.snippet: There are many centers, which should be the first stop for victims, that offer proper care and increase the likelihood that their attackers are punished.
